dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not hot, your feet are cold. PAULINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop touching me. I am so hot. Feel my head. Margot puts her lips to Pauline's forehead. MARGOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a fever. PAULINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have a fever... I'm pregnant...are you always like this? MARGOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get used to it... Mom and Becky share a bed -- you and I will probably get the other. PAULINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should just go to Vermont.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was thinking -- you know if you want -- you and Ingrid could go to Vermont. Keep Claude company and Jim adores you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't like Malcolm because you're not attracted to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I won't do that for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you two talk about me in town? What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told him you often change your mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheap plastic tables. A small karaoke stage in front. Margot, Claude, Pauline and Ingrid sit at the bar. Margot drinks her wine with ice. She wears Jim's sweater. The ki have Cokes. The remains of ketchup-soaked french fries in plastic red basket lie between them. A man with a mullet climbs up on the karaoke stage. The music begins. The man sways and sings "On and On" by Step Bishop. He croons sweetly and beautifully. Claude's eyes moisten. Margot swallows a blue pill and chases it with t wine. She takes her son's hand and whispers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, sweety. There's something wrong with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to call him. Margot quickly turns to her sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   Don't. I'm telling you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I...I need some clothes and things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He should get the hell out of our house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I'll tell him to get the hell out of our house. Pauline walks over to a pay phone.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Pauline holds the receiver to her ear. She stares at a drawing of a monster fucking a woman on the wall above th pay phone. Malcolm is crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tent looks so lonely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has no one to get married in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malcolm sits in the grass, the tree and wreckage behind h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. And it's smashed. I'm such a fucking idiot. Please don't take me seriously. I mean take me seriously, but not the fucked up parts, you know. I love you so much. Please marry me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't do what you did again. Do you understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No matter how tempting. At the bar: Margot watches her sister carefully. She abse mindedly picks through her red knit bracelet and drops it onto the floor. Ingrid slides something small and grey across the bar to Claude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INGRID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You left it in my room. It's a piece of fingernail.   He hesitates then puts it i pocket. At the phone: Pauline rests her head against the wall. Malcolm is bawling on the other end. PAULINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I don't know. Malcolm clutches Wizard and sputters: MALCOLM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ate some of the cake.   I don't know why, but I did it. PAULINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was... How was it? MALCOLM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. PAULINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not too sweet? They sometimes make their stuff too sweet. MALCOLM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. Maybe it was. I didn't even notice... They fucked up the cake. How sad. I love our little baby. I miss you. PAULINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss you too. Maybe we should do another seminar. Malcolm says something incomprehensible. PAULINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't understand you, honey. Margot finishes her glass of wine, her eyes still on her sister. INGRID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's gramma and Aunt Becky! Margot startles and looks out the window. Across the stre is an older woman, 70's, and a large woman, mid 30's, eat ice cream cones and looking in a boarded-up shop window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They didn't get my message. Pauline now stands above them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you she can't work the machine -- Ingrid's chair scrapes as she stands.      She takes her hand. Margot remains seated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?   You're not coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm coming, I'm coming.       What did he say? Pauline and Ingrid head for the door.      Claude waits f Margot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he say? She grabs her bags and drops some bills on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, I got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sisters and children come outside.      The mother an now idle further down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom!/Nana! Margot takes Claude's arm and walks quickly in the opposi direction. Claude, confused, glances over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look. Keep walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to get you to your bus.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: A huge parking lot. A bus in the distance.   Claude tries keep pace with his mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you do something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, do something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, why is the wedding not happening? Is there something that you did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pauline has transferred all her stuff onto me. I don't understand her anymore. Why'd she pick this man? It is really berserk. And you know, she referred to me as her closest friend. We never see one anoth -- An unfamiliar sound comes out of Margot. The sadness is unexpected -- she sobs uncontrollably. She tries to speak

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean we're not close.   Even if we want to be. You know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But was there anything real?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! How many times do I have to say it? Jesus. You think so little of me. (through her sobs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good you're going. You shouldn't be around me either. I'd go if I were you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you find Pauline and Nana after I leave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (half-serious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Maybe I'll go to church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margot is sweating. She wipes her brow with her sleeve. S periodically looks behind her. Nobody seems to be followi CLAUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (growing nervous) Are you angry at me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, honey.     I'm not mad at you. CLAUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to go with you mad at anyone. MARGOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's fine.    I'm not mad at anyone. Up ahead is a tiny depot.    People climb onto a white bu CLAUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you come with me? MARGOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you know that. (pause) We should talk about the next few months a little bit and what's going to happen -- CLAUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like Vermont. MARGOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your dad will be very happy to see you. And I'm sure Josh is dying to hang out. CLAUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please come, mom. MARGOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly irritable) Claude, stop it. Okay? She watches a man sustain a long embrace with another man Margot closes her eyes. She breathes deeply. MARGOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You used to need me to watch you when you played.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLAUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? MARGOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (vaguely) When you first started to play with friends, you wouldn't do it unless I watched you. You were afraid I would go out the back door. I don't know where I would go. Our yard didn't lead anywhere anyway. She takes off her sweater and reveals an old faded yellow shirt. She isn't wearing a bra. Claude says suddenly: CLAUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I masturbated last night. While everyone was asleep I went into the bathroom and did it. MARGOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to tell me, sweety. The bus driver slams the luggage compartment closed. MARGOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to go. Margot ties her sweater around her waist and takes Claude hand. They approach the bus. Claude's body tenses. CLAUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How will you get home? MARGOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I'll see. Maybe Dick can drive me to the... (pause) Jesus, I lost the word for a second. The train. CLAUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh. He looks at her longingly. MARGOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. You always don't want to leave me and you always have a good time once you do. (provocatively) I think you like getting away from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLAUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do not.    I like hanging out with you. She hugs him.   He clutches her. CLAUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The world feels strange to me right now. Margot nods sympathetically. She kisses his lips and releases him. He reaches into his bag and shyly puts on h wrap-around punk sunglasses. Margot makes a face. CLAUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? MARGOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They make your face look too wide. Claude removes them and puts them back in the bag. CLAUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you soon. MARGOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye, sweety. CLAUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, you'll see me "soon." MARGOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're acting like a baby. She backs away -- CLAUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't see Dick. MARGOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. I don't think he wants to see me anyway. CLAUDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Margot. Promise me. MARGOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitates) Don't call me that. Claude doesn't move. Margot points at the bus and mouths "Go". She turns in the other direction. Claude, frustrate and anxious approaches the vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claude hurries toward the back and finds a window seat. puts his bag next to him and looks out the dirty glass. Claude's POV: Margot, her back to him, puts her finger in ear and shakes her head. The sweater around her waist loosens and drifts to the pavement. She starts walking. The bus hisses and lurches forward.    Claude strains to Margot looks back. The bus groans as it picks up speed.   Margot sprints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! She's runs full speed, waving her arms wildly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!   Wait! She pants, breathless. The bus brakes. She passes Claude's window. We stay on Claude. He waits. Finally, she appears next to him, covered in sweat, and panting. She kisses him on the head. The bus starts movin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost euphoric)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see me running out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Margot cranes her neck to see outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. That was a lot of running. I'm out of breath. Claude turns away from his mother and looks out the windo CUT TO BLACK.
